title: Looks like Riot really did well with the power progression on Kayle.
body:
A problem I've always had is that the 'late game champions' such as Vayne and Nasus are just too strong early game to really be considered 'late game champions'. In my opinion if a champion is extremely strong late game, they MUST have a weak early game and Kayle accomplishes that.

From the gameplay I've seen, Kayle has a very weak, but very manageable early game/laning phase for her first 2 forms. Then once she reaches level 11, she becomes an actual champion and is allowed to exist, and level 16 she wreaks havoc on everything.

This is what I've always wanted in a late-game champion. Vayne just does too much damage and has mobility and cc and everything early game, Nasus is just a fuckin nuisance, but Kayle actually has a very weak early game that smoothly transitions into a very strong late game.

This thread probably had bad structure and whatnot, but I just wanna get these thoughts out because I'm very happy to see this.

Good job Riot! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Well, no. She has 4 forms of progression, and by the looks of it, this is how it goes.

1. (1-6) Yeah, she's a tower hugger and just gets the scraps of CS. Considering she's a late-game powerhouse, this is fair.

2. (6-11) She has her ulti and a new form, so she's still fairly weak but can definitely put up a lil bit of a fight, she's kinda like Kayn before getting his form. Not super weak but will get stronger to compensate.

3. (11-16) Now she's really doing well. She can kite people and do damage and now feels like she's really getting strong and can put up a good fight.

4. (16-18) She's extremely strong now and is one of the strongest champions in the game at this point, which is good because the entire game has been leading up to this. Yes, her team has an advantage because she's on the team. This is because if she survived all of that weakness she kinda deserves to be rewarded with a ton of strength. And nothing is an instant-win. Kayle will still be able to lose at this point, just like how anyone who's fed can lose.

I think this will bring some balance issues though. You see {{champion:141}} has a similar thing going on, hes really weak early and becomes a champion once he gets his transform. Kayn's transform only takes around 10 minutes though, and you have to wait a lot longer on Kayle to be able to actually do something.
